column2: KENTUCKY DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Kentucky

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.

column2: 2. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column6: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column8: wait until traffic ahead is clear.

column2: 3. When driving at night, drivers should:
column4: look directly into the oncoming headlights of approaching vehicles.

column2: 4. When preparing to drive, you should:
column4: adjust your seat and mirrors.

column2: 5. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: The same as a green light.
column6: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column8: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 6. To avoid glare from headlights of an approaching car:
column4: stay focused on the center line on the road.
column8: don't look directly into the oncoming headlights, look toward the right edge of your lane.

column2: 7. This sign indicates that:
column4: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.
column6: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
column8: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.

column2: 8. Which of the following is a common cause of traffic collisions?
column4: Scanning the road ahead and staying focused on the driving task.
column6: Pedestrians being key participants in the transportation system.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: The maximum speed limit under ideal conditions
column6: You must travel at the speed indicated

column2: 10. When is the pavement most slippery?
column4: If it's been raining several hours.
column6: When it's been raining from at least one hour.
column8: When it has just begun to rain.

column2: 11. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.
column6: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.

column2: 12. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column8: signal turns, lane changes and stops.

column2: 13. As your speed increases it is most important to:
column4: drive with both hands on steering wheel.

column2: 14. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column6: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 15. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
column4: take precedence over

column2: 16. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column6: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column8: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.

column2: 17. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column6: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column8: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.

column2: 18. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column4: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.

column2: 19. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the left edge of the road.
column6: on the left shoulder of the road.
column8: near the right curb or edge of the road.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: Left turns are permitted
column8: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 21. A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
column4: next to the solid line may pass.
column8: next to the broken line may pass.

column2: 22. BAC is expressed in:
column4: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 23. There are two traffic lanes in your direction. You are driving in the left lane and many vehicles are passing you on the right, and the driver behind you wishes to drive faster. You should:
column4: move over into the right lane when safe to do so.
column6: drive onto the left shoulder to let the other driver pass.
column8: stay in your lane and maintain your current speed.

column2: 24. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column4: hill

column2: 25. If one of your tires blows out while driving, you should:
column4: apply the brakes firmly and steer toward the right edge of the road.
column8: hold the steering wheel firmly, slow down, and steer smoothly.

column2: 26. Most signs used in street work areas are:
column4: rectangle shaped.

column2: 27. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are fatigued.
column6: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.

column2: 28. A broken white line:
column4: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column6: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.
column8: marks the right edge of the roadway.

column2: 29. Just like alcohol and other drugs, drowsiness can:
column4: help you to be a better driver.

column2: 30. This road sign indicates that:
column4: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column6: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.
column8: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.

column2: 31. This road sign means:
column4: Low clearance

column2: 32. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Not drinking over a period of time.
column8: Eating before or while you drink.

column2: 33. This road sign means:
column4: Sharp curve ahead

column2: 34. This road sign means:
column4: Do not block intersection

column2: 35. Regulatory signs are:
column4: green.

column2: 36. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.
column6: get off the road and check your tires.

column2: 37. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.

column2: 38. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
column6: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.

column2: 39. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who have overslept.
column6: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

column2: 40. Night driving can be more difficult because:
column4: the speed limit is increased at night.
column6: there are more cars on the roads at night.
column8: vehicle speed and distance are harder to judge.
